messages.message: Regarding IBOCR bloat conversations from a while ago, if this is still a problem and just needs a quick fix, I have a notebook that does some size reduction. Even with confidence levels still tracked, it achieves a 45% reduction in file/object size. It's kind of janky and experimental, but if a quick fix is needed, you can always use this technique and have a `compress()` and `inflate()` function available that does the conversion for you: https://www.instabase.com/user/vontell-nb/notebooks/vontell/workspace/fs/Instabase%20Drive/experiments/reduced-ibocr-size/IBOCR%20Reduction.ipynb

Basic idea is to convert long lists of dictionaries into dictionaries of lists, and then replace key names with 1-2 character alternatives - pretty simple changes like that can get quite a reduction in size already, and I bet there are techniques to bring this down even further
Primary goal would be to represent IBOCRs via protobufs, but considering the wide and varying range of formats and keys within IBOCRs, not sure how practical or easy this would be.

Also note that the space savings with confidence information removed would also still be improved, but probably not as drastic as 45%, since a lot of the compression happens within those confidence elements

:thumbsup_all: Nice, have some other proposals as well, especially around avoiding copies of data .. we can then combine that will the `inflate / compress` technique to achieve even higher level of size reduction.
